question.text:
Match List-I with List-II relating to microbes and their products:

$\begin{array}{|l|l|r|l|} \hline & \begin{array}{l} \text{List-I} \\ \text{(Microbes)} \end{array} & & \begin{array}{l} \text{List-II} \\ \text{(Products)} \end{array} \\ \hline A. & \text{Streptococcus} & I. & \text{Citric acid} \\ \hline B. & \text{Trichoderma polysporum} & II. & \text{Clot buster} \\ \hline C. & \text{Monascus purpureus} & III. & \text{Cyclosporin A} \\ \hline D. & \text{Aspergillus niger} & IV. & \text{Statins} \\ \hline \end{array}$

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:

solution.text:
Streptokinase is produced by Streptococcus and is used as a clot buster for removing clots from the blood vessels of patients who have undergone myocardial infarction leading to heart attack.
- Cyclosporin A, that is used as an immuno-suppressive agent in organ-transplant patients, it is produced by the fungus Trichoderma polysporum
- Statins produced by Monascus purpureus have been commercialized as blood-cholesterol lowering agent.
- Citric acid is produced by Aspergillus niger
